Issues.Title: BUG: IVY change detection on push for component within ng-template not invalidated
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
@angular/core
@angular/common

### Is this a regression?

Yes definitely yes, it is working without ivy without any problem.

### Description

When you have components set to `ChangeDetectionStrategy.OnPush` and you have component which obtains `TemplateRef` from its *content* using `ContentChild` for example, then you put component inside this template and change one of its inputs, change detection is not triggered inside this component.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

Here is working version with Angular 8 without IVY
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-xfuujc

And here (branch *ivy-error*) is not working version with Angular 9-next.12 with IVY
https://github.com/kukjevov/ng-universal-demo

> `git clone https://github.com/kukjevov/ng-universal-demo.git`
> `git checkout ivy-error`
> `npm install`
> `npm start`
> open browser at `http://localhost:8888`

## üî• Exception or Error

There is one async change after 5 seconds to `data "bla bla"` and also it is possible to click on button which will cause change of displayed value. In stackblitz it is working, in provided repo it is not working.

## üåç  Your Environment

**Angular Version:**
Angular 9-next.12

**Anything else relevant?**
Windows: 10.0.17763
Node: 11.6.0
NPM: 6.9.0
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "BUG: IVY change detection on push for component within ng-template not invalidated" (#33285)

Issues.Title: perf(ivy): avoid unnecessary i18n pass while processing a template
Issues.Body:
Prior to this commit, we always invoked second i18n pass (in case whitespace removal is on, which is a default), even if a given template doesn't contain i18n information. Now we store a flag (that indicates presence of i18n information in a template) during first i18n pass and use it to check whether second pass is needed.

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)


## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "perf(ivy): avoid unnecessary i18n pass while processing a template" (#33284)

Issues.Title: Adding a friendly Url in Dynamic Views of Angular8 to use SEO
Issues.Body:
i'm using Angular routing to switch between views.

My version of Angular is `"@angular/core": "~8.0.0"`

This is how it's done today:

`www.mywebsite.com.br`

When i chose some view, i load a data from the server to show the info, and the URL look's like this:

`www.mywebsite.com.br/course/1`

But, to use SEO in my website i need to show the tittle of the course in the URL, like this:

`www.mywebsite.com.br/how-to-use-a-computer`

And when i navigate inside this course i need to create the path, like this:

`www.mywebsite.com.br/how-to-use-a-computer/my-first-class`
This, my routes:

```
const routes = [

  {path: 'manufacturer/:id_ manufacturer', component: ManufacturerComponent},

  {path: 'course/:id_course', component: CourseComponent},

  {path: 'category/:id_ category', component: CategoryComponent},

  {path: 'course/:id_course/class/:id_ class', component: ClassComponent},
];
```
There is anyway to change the URL?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Adding a friendly Url in Dynamic Views of Angular8 to use SEO" (#33280)

Issues.Title: docs: document public_api_guard and Golden files
Issues.Body:
# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report

### Description
When any contributor submits a PR to the project, they may see build failures like the following

<details>
  <summary>CircleCI Test Failure</summary>

```ts
FAIL: //tools/public_api_guard:forms_api (see /home/circleci/.cache/bazel/_bazel_circleci/9ce5c2144ecf75d11717c0aa41e45a8d/execroot/angular/bazel-out/k8-fastbuild/testlogs/tools/public_api_guard/forms_api/test_attempts/attempt_1.log)
FAIL: //tools/public_api_guard:forms_api (see /home/circleci/.cache/bazel/_bazel_circleci/9ce5c2144ecf75d11717c0aa41e45a8d/execroot/angular/bazel-out/k8-fastbuild/testlogs/tools/public_api_guard/forms_api/test.log)

FAILED: //tools/public_api_guard:forms_api (Summary)
      /home/circleci/.cache/bazel/_bazel_circleci/9ce5c2144ecf75d11717c0aa41e45a8d/execroot/angular/bazel-out/k8-fastbuild/testlogs/tools/public_api_guard/forms_api/test.log
      /home/circleci/.cache/bazel/_bazel_circleci/9ce5c2144ecf75d11717c0aa41e45a8d/execroot/angular/bazel-out/k8-fastbuild/testlogs/tools/public_api_guard/forms_api/test_attempts/attempt_1.log
INFO: From Testing //tools/public_api_guard:forms_api:
==================== Test output for //tools/public_api_guard:forms_api:
--- tools/public_api_guard/forms/forms.d.ts	Golden file
+++ tools/public_api_guard/forms/forms.d.ts	Generated API
@@ -4,9 +4,9 @@
     readonly disabled: boolean;
     readonly enabled: boolean;
     readonly errors: ValidationErrors | null;
     readonly invalid: boolean;
-    readonly parent: FormGroup | FormArray;
+    readonly parent: FormGroup | FormArray | undefined;
     readonly pending: boolean;
     readonly pristine: boolean;
     readonly root: AbstractControl;
     readonly status: string;


Accept the new golden file:
  bazel run //tools/public_api_guard:forms_api.accept
================================================================================
==================== Test output for //tools/public_api_guard:forms_api:
--- tools/public_api_guard/forms/forms.d.ts	Golden file
+++ tools/public_api_guard/forms/forms.d.ts	Generated API
@@ -4,9 +4,9 @@
     readonly disabled: boolean;
     readonly enabled: boolean;
     readonly errors: ValidationErrors | null;
     readonly invalid: boolean;
-    readonly parent: FormGroup | FormArray;
+    readonly parent: FormGroup | FormArray | undefined;
     readonly pending: boolean;
     readonly pristine: boolean;
     readonly root: AbstractControl;
     readonly status: string;


Accept the new golden file:
  bazel run //tools/public_api_guard:forms_api.accept
================================================================================
```
</details>

The important output here is the following

```sh
Accept the new golden file:
  bazel run //tools/public_api_guard:forms_api.accept
```

#### Issues

- "Accept the new golden file"
  - These words have little to no meaning to new contributors
  - It is not clear that this is an instruction to the PR author
- `bazel run //tools/public_api_guard:forms_api.accept`
  - For contributors who have never used [Bazel](https://bazel.build/) before
    - It's not clear that this is a shell command
    - It's also not clear that `public_api_guard:forms_api.accept` is a script or a runnable target
- There is no explanation here (or link to) about what is wrong or why the PR author needs to take an action.
- There is no explanation here (or link to) on how to read the API diff and how to think about or make API changes. 

#### Mitigation
- `CONTRIBUTING.md` should mention and have some kind of link to the full description of this message, `public_api_guard`, and Golden files.
- `DEVELOPER.md` should mention and have some kind of link to the full description of this message, `public_api_guard`, and Golden files.
- `COMMITTER.md` or a new `.md` file may be the correct place to put the full description of this message, `public_api_guard`, and Golden files.
  - It would be nice to link to the [API deprecation policy](https://angular.io/guide/releases#deprecation-practices) in that explanation.
- Update the CircleCI output from `public_api_guard` to link to the full description.

### Expected vs Actual Behavior**
Expected to find some documentation describing this in one of these
- https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
- https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/docs/DEVELOPER.md
- https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/docs/COMMITTER.md
- https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/docs/CARETAKER.md
- https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/docs/PR_REVIEW.md
- https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/docs/TOOLS.md

but found nothing.

[PUBLIC_API.md](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/docs/PUBLIC_API.md) starts to touch on some of the relevant concepts, but it doesn't cover anything from the contributor or PR author's perspective. 

## üåç  Your Environment

### Browser info
N/A

### Anything else relevant?
Related issues
- https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/26589
- https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/28406

Full build job and failure that the above CircleCI output was sourced from: https://circleci.com/gh/angular/angular/457388

2. If 'app-test' is a Web Component then add 'CUSTOM_ELEMENTS_SCHEMA' to the '@NgModule.schemas' of this component to suppress this message.
3. To allow any property add 'NO_ERRORS_SCHEMA' to the '@NgModule.schemas' of this component.

            ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

  src/app/app.component.ts:5:16
    5   templateUrl: './app.component.html',
                     ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    Error occurs in the template of component AppComponent.
```

If Ivy is not enabled, the compiler will not cause an error.

Issues.Title: feat(ivy): strictness flags for template type checking
Issues.Body:
**feat(ivy): strictness flags for template type checking**

The template type checking abilities of the Ivy compiler are far more
advanced than the level of template type checking that was previously
done for Angular templates. Up until now, a single compiler option
called "fullTemplateTypeCheck" was available to configure the level
of template type checking. However, now that more advanced type checking
is being done, new errors may surface that were previously not reported,
in which case it may not be feasible to fix all new errors at once.

Having only a single option to disable a large number of template type
checking capabilities does not allow for incrementally addressing newly
reported types of errors. As a solution, this commit introduces some new
compiler options to be able to enable/disable certain kinds of template
type checks on a fine-grained basis.

---

**feat(ivy): add flag to disable checking of empty attributes**

For elements that have a static attribute without a value, which is
typically the case for attributes like `disabled`, it may happen that
the element is matched by a directive that consumes the attribute as an
input. In that case, the template type checker will validate the
correctness of the attribute with respect to the directive's declared
type of the input, which would typically be `boolean` for the `disabled`
input. Since empty attributes are assigned the empty string at runtime,
the template type checker would report an error for this template.

This commit introduces a strictness flag to help alleviate this
particular situation, effectively ignoring empty attributes that happen
to be consumed by a directive.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(ivy): strictness flags for template type checking" (#33273)

Issues.Title: Ivy - ASSERTION ERROR: Expecting LContainer
Issues.Body:
Angular Version: 9.0.0-next.12 I tried ivy with our app and hit an error. Sadly I can't share it and I couldn't boil it down to a reproduction :(. Posting it anyway as you can maybe make sense of it. Have the state stil locally if you need more details. The debugger stops here: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/905328/67149642-f37f9700-f2ad-11e9-8a77-3af5a7d3ed6a.png) And this is a few layers up in the stack: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/905328/67149663-30e42480-f2ae-11e9-85c2-9643faa3a370.png) Ivy access index 53 in LView and expects there to be an LContainer (?) from, but gets a string. The component was way more complex, but this is what I reduced it to: ```typescript @Component({ selector: 'media-pdp-above-the-fold', styleUrls: ['./media-pdp-above-the-fold-component.scss'], template: `
{{ 'foo1' | trans }} {{ 'foo2' | trans: {}:'countries' }}
{{ 'foo3' | trans }}
  • {{ 'foo4' | trans }} {{ 199 | ryCurrency }}

{{ 'foo5' | trans }}

{{ 'foo6' | trans }}

 `, }) export class MediaPdpAboveTheFoldComponent { @Input() public productView: ProductViewResponse; constructor(public freeShipping: FreeShipping) {} } ``` If I fiddle around with that template more, the error disappears or other errors appear. This is the contents of LView: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/905328/67149709-d8f9ed80-f2ae-11e9-9418-beff41fc2b9d.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/905328/67149719-ed3dea80-f2ae-11e9-9170-4fb4c4176663.png) Any ideas?

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): align VE + Ivy #ref types in fullTemplateTypeCheck: false
Issues.Body:
In View Engine, with fullTemplateTypeCheck mode disabled, the type of any
inferred based on the entity being referenced. This is a bug, since the
goal with fullTemplateTypeCheck: false is for Ivy and VE to be aligned in
terms of type inference.

This commit adds a 'checkTypeOfReference' flag in the TypeCheckingConfig
to control this inference, and sets it to false when fullTemplateTypeCheck
is disabled.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): align VE + Ivy #ref types in fullTemplateTypeCheck: false" (#33261)

Issues.Title: Page should start at top when URL is changed in browser bar as in in-app route changes via links
Issues.Body:
# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report

### Description
When I enter a different URL in the URL bar once inside of AIO, the scroll location is kept. 

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
Scroll a bit down on a page and then change the URL in the ULR browser bar. See repro steps below.

### What's the affected URL?**
All

### Reproduction Steps**
- Go to https://www.angular.io/tutorial/toh-pt5
- Scroll a bit down
- Change URL to https://www.angular.io/tutorial/toh-pt2
- See that document page starts at the same scroll location as last page, not at the top as expected

### Expected vs Actual Behavior**
A user might expect that when a URL route change happens (as when you click on links) that they start at the top of the page.

Issues.Title: feat(ivy): give shim generation its own compiler options
Issues.Body:
As a hack to get the Ivy compiler ngtsc off the ground, the existing
'allowEmptyCodegenFiles' option was used to control generation of ngfactory
and ngsummary shims during compilation. This option was selected since it's
enabled in google3 but never enabled in external projects.

As ngtsc is now mature and the role shims play in compilation is now better
understood across the ecosystem, this commit introduces two new compiler
options to control shim generation:

* generateNgFactoryShims controls the generation of .ngfactory shims.
* generateNgSummaryShims controls the generation of .ngsummary shims.

The 'allowEmptyCodegenFiles' option is still honored if either of the above
flags are not set explicitly.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(ivy): give shim generation its own compiler options" (#33256)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): sockPath for custom path
Issues.Body:
Fixes #9146 # Issue ```bash # setup project ng new base-href-socket-path --style=css --inlineStyle=true --inlineTemplate=true --routing=false --minimal=true # Start server with baseHref and publicHost ng serve --baseHref="/my-app/" --publicHost="http://localhost:4200/my-app" ``` The auto-reload `sockjs-node/*` websocket requests fails with a 404: E.g. `curl http://localhost:4200/my-app/sockjs-node/info` returns: ```html > GET /my-app/sockjs-node/info HTTP/1.1 > Host: localhost:4200 > User-Agent: curl/7.54.0 > Accept: */* > < HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found < X-Powered-By: Express < Access-Control-Allow-Origin: * < Content-Security-Policy: default-src 'none' < X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff < Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8 < Content-Length: 162 < Date: Sat, 19 Oct 2019 13:43:22 GMT < Connection: keep-alive < Error 
Cannot GET /my-app/sockjs-node/info
``` setting webpack dev-servers [`sockPath`](https://webpack.js.org/configuration/dev-server/#devserversockpath) to connect to reloading socket via custom path when serving the app on a custom path. See https://github.com/micmro/angular-base-href-reload-socket-path-workaround for issue and a currently working workaround using `@angular-builders/custom-webpack`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): sockPath for custom path" (#15883)

Issues.Title: build: update rollup to version 1.25.1
Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [rollup](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup) | dependencies | minor | [`1.24.0` -> `1.25.1`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/rollup/1.24.0/1.25.1) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>rollup/rollup</summary>

### [`v1.25.1`](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​1251)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/compare/v1.25.0...v1.25.1)

_2019-10-20_

##### Bug Fixes

-   Handle a situation where code was not included after a switch statement ([#​3178](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3178))
-   Handle a situation where code was not included after a do-while loop ([#​3180](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3180))
-   Do not fail if different outputs emit the same file ([#​3175](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3175))
-   Give access to the original acorn error for parse errors ([#​3176](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3176))

##### Pull Requests

-   [#​3175](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/pull/3175): Disable errors for duplicate emitted file names ([@​marijnh](https://togithub.com/marijnh))
-   [#​3176](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/pull/3176): Add original parser error to rollup error; Update tests ([@​gribnoysup](https://togithub.com/gribnoysup))
-   [#​3178](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/pull/3178): Fix switch case not being included correctly ([@​lukastaegert](https://togithub.com/lukastaegert))
-   [#​3179](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/pull/3179): Update dependencies ([@​lukastaegert](https://togithub.com/lukastaegert))
-   [#​3180](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/pull/3180): Handle conditional breaks in do-while loops with unconditional return ([@​lukastaegert](https://togithub.com/lukastaegert))

### [`v1.25.0`](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​1250)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/compare/v1.24.0...v1.25.0)

_2019-10-18_

##### Features

-   Remove try-catch if there is no side-effect in the try-block ([#​3166](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3166))
-   Omit side-effect-free trailing cases in switch-statements ([#​3166](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3166))
-   Remove unused labels ([#​3170](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3170))

##### Bug Fixes

-   Do not remove code after labeled statements that contain a throw or return if the label is used ([#​3170](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3170))
-   Prevent invalid code when expressions are simplified that do not follow a white-space character ([#​3173](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3173))
-   Do not remove continue statements inside switch statements ([#​3166](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3166))
-   Prevent trailing empty lines when tree-shaking inside switch statements ([#​3166](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3166))

##### Pull Requests

-   [#​3166](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/pull/3166): Better try statement tree shaking ([@​lukastaegert](https://togithub.com/lukastaegert))
-   [#​3170](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/pull/3170): Handle optional control flow in labeled statements, remove unused labels ([@​lukastaegert](https://togithub.com/lukastaegert))
-   [#​3173](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/pull/3173): Add missing spaces in certain statements and expressions to avoid invalid code ([@​lukastaegert](https://togithub.com/lukastaegert))

</details>

Issues.Title: "Machine-In-The-Middle" Vulnerability Caused by https-proxy-agent Dependency
Issues.Body:
This was an NPM advisory that was [published earlier today](https://npmjs.com/advisories/1184). Running `npm audit fix` does not solve the problem. Seems like the fix is as simple as updating this dependency for angular-cli.

````bash
                       === npm audit security report ===                        
                                 Manual Review                                  
             Some vulnerabilities require your attention to resolve             
                                                                                
          Visit https://go.npm.me/audit-guide for additional guidance           


  High            Machine-In-The-Middle                                         

  Package         https-proxy-agent                                             

  Patched in      >=3.0.0                                                       

  Dependency of   @angular/cli [dev]                                            

  Path            @angular/cli > @schematics/update > pacote >                  
                  make-fetch-happen > https-proxy-agent                         

  More info       https://npmjs.com/advisories/1184                             
````

### Command (mark with an `x`)

```

### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> A clear and concise description of the problem or missing capability...
There is no way today to generate a workspace using a specific package manager. The Angular CLI uses the package manager defined in the global config or if no default package manager is specified it uses NPM.

Add an option `--package-manager` to the `ng-new` and `workspace` schematics.
I will create a PR for this soon :)

Issues.Title: Allow directTemplateLoading to be set from angular.json
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [x] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description

The `AngularCompilerPlugin` allows templates to be [loaded directly](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/e8cdfa6020b8856498f9ea86b1fbbddb3f767975/packages/ngtools/webpack/src/interfaces.ts#L46), bypassing any loaders configured in the webpack config. The [default value](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/e8cdfa6020b8856498f9ea86b1fbbddb3f767975/packages/ngtools/webpack/src/compiler_host.ts#L48) of this option is `false`.

The Angular CLI creates an instance of the `AngularCompilerPlugin` and sets this option to `true`, with no way of overriding this behavior.
https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/e8cdfa6020b8856498f9ea86b1fbbddb3f767975/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/angular-cli-files/models/webpack-configs/typescript.ts#L94

Setting this to `true` made sense when there was no way to customize the webpack config. However, now that CLI Builders are [officially supported](https://blog.angular.io/introducing-cli-builders-d012d4489f1b), it will become more common for builders like [`@angular-builders/custom-webpack`](https://github.com/just-jeb/angular-builders/tree/master/packages/custom-webpack) to be used to customize the webpack configuration. But with `directTemplateLoading` being hard-coded to `true`, there is no way to customize the webpack configuration to allow a loader to manipulate a component's template.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Let the `directTemplateLoading` option be set in the `angular.json` file. For example:

```json
"architect": {
  "build": {
    "builder": "@angular-builders/custom-webpack:browser",
    "options": {
      "directTemplateLoading": false,
      "customWebpackConfig": {
        "path": "./webpack.config.js"
      },
      "etc": "etc"
```


### Describe alternatives you've considered

This idea has been raised before in a couple of issues, but both were closed with workarounds or hacks. Since CLI Builders are now officially supported, I feel that a proper solution is required.

#### Use `template` and inline loaders

https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/14855#issuecomment-510592634 suggests using `template` and specifying the loaders in the require statement instead of using `templateUrl`.

> Hi all, we had a chat around this, and we think that if you want to use webpack specific stuff you can use [ngx-build-plus](https://github.com/manfredsteyer/ngx-build-plus) or otherwise you can update the require statements to include the raw-loader import syntax ie: `require('!raw-loader!./path-to-template.html')` as suggested above.

Manually specifying the same loaders for _every_ component template is not maintainable.

#### Hack the webpack config

https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/14534#issuecomment-496666971 states that a hack is required to set `directTemplateLoading`:

> Closing as the above method is a necessary step to augment an existing plugin within a webpack configuration.

The "above method" is to search through the plugins in the webpack config and find the `AngularCompilerPlugin`, get it's options, change the `directTemplateLoading` value to false, create a new instance of the plugin with the modified options and replace the original plugin in the webpack config. Very hacky.

#### Use `template` with loaders in the webpack config

Similar to the outcome of #14855, you can:

1. Install `@types/node`.
2. Add `"node"` to the `types` property of the tsconfig file.
3. Change `templateUrl: './foo.component.html` to `template: require('./foo.component.html')`

and the custom loaders specified in the webpack config will be used. _But_ this requires you to make changes to the way the component's template is specified by default, which is easy to forget to do. That's just asking for problems because forgetting to change `templateUrl` to `template` means it won't be passed through the custom loaders.

In addition to that, the Angular Language Service complains that _"Component 'FooComponent' must have a template or templateUrl"_.  

Given the choice between this and hacking the webpack config to recreate the `AngularCompilerPlugin`, I'd choose hacking the webpack config. üòÅ
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Allow directTemplateLoading to be set from angular.json" (#15861)

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [ ] new
- [x ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
In our development environment setup, we have individual developer's node_modules link to project's node_modules which is controlled by architects who decides what packages should be used in the project.

However, when individual developers tried to build their own instance, we encounter this error:
`
[exec] Generating ES5 bundles for differential loading...

[exec] An unhandled exception occurred: EPERM: operation not permitted, lchown '....../node_modules/.cache/angular-build-dl/content-v2/sha512/d4/20'`

It appears during the build, ng will create some temporary files under node_modules/.cache and even perform chown operation on it. 

The build fails because individual developer does not have sufficient permission to operate on project's node_modules directory.

### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> 
I wonder whether it's possible to have a build option that allow changing default cache directory. So we can set it to individual developer's own environment where they have sufficient permission.

Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [x ] new - [x ] build - [x ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? Yes, in the previous version this bug was not present. ### Description A clear and concise description of the problem... When you save scss file, and cli automatically rebuild the changes doesn't apply and you have to save file again for it to correctly work. I guess it's caused by not deleting all virtual files for styles on change. This issue came back after fix of #15453 and it was once solved in #15143. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 1. ng s --aot 2. make changes in scss file 3. save 4.it reloads and changes are not applied 5. save once again 6. it rebuilds and now it shows changes ## üåç Your Environment

Issues.Title: Add param in config to exclude files to help to solve the "heap out of memory" issue
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [ ] build

```

### Description
Hi There,

I had suffered a lot from the "heap out of memory" issue recently. That is caused by the source map for my case. (Angular 7 + Node 8 + window10)

I found this function in webpack config utility: (node_modules\@angular-devkit\build-angular\src\angular-cli-files\models\webpack-configs\utils.js)
`function getSourceMapDevTool
    ...............
    
    return new webpack_1.SourceMapDevToolPlugin({
        filename: inlineSourceMap ? undefined : '[file].map',
        include,
        exclude: ['vendor.js'],    **<----  Here, I excluded vendor.js and the issue gone. Build speed is much faster and it almost did not affect daily debugging!**
        append: hiddenSourceMap ? false : undefined,
    });
`

I noticed that there is a configuration in "angular.json" ["sourceMap"](https://angular.io/guide/workspace-config#optimization-and-source-map-configuration) under architect->build->option;
Could you guys please add an "exclude" param in that object? So that specified file could be excluded by us individually. If you can add that function, that might help a lot of people. Thank you! 

Thanks,
Joey
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add param in config to exclude files to help to solve the "heap out of memory" issue" (#15862)

Issues.Title: fix(schematics): secondary entry point migration not working against v9
Issues.Body:
Currently the secondary entry point migration uses the type checker to figure out which Material module a symbol belongs to. This won't work in v9, because we removed the top-level `@angular/material`. These changes fall back to looking up the name of the symbol in a list of known symbols and their module names.

Fixes #17433.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(schematics): secondary entry point migration not working against v9" (#17452)

Issues.Title: Enhance the mat-paginator so the total length can be masked.
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

Provide the way to mask the 'total length'. 

#### Use Case

With large data set, getting the count from the backend database is slow. We'd like to mask the "total length", so the users can paginate without having to know the max length. The end user would be able to continue to paginate until there is no results from the backend. 

Two issues

1. You wouldn't know the actual max length.
2. If the last page set returns the same as the page size, then it would still allow to paginate to next page. However, there would be no results.


The end user who can live with these two issues can simply mask the total length by specifying the display label  such as "More" or "..."

Example.

200-300 (More) "<"  ">"
Or
200-300 (...) "<"  ">"

<mat-paginator [maskTotal]="true"  [maskTotalLabel]="'More'"
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Enhance the mat-paginator so the total length can be masked." (#17449)

Issues.Title: refactor: hammer migration should add "HammerModule" if needed
Issues.Body:
The v9 HammerJS migration should add the `HammerModule` to the
app module if needed.

Additionally if HammerJS is not used in templates (or in general),
we remove references to the "HammerModule". This scenario can happen
if someone updates to v9 Angular while keeping Angular Material v8. In
that case, the author will add the `HammerModule` to the app module and
whenever the update to v9+ Angular Material is performed, the `HammerModule`
is not needed anymore.. so we can remove it automatically.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor: hammer migration should add "HammerModule" if needed" (#17444)

Issues.Title: matTabLink `disabled` input should be `matTabLinkDisabled`
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-zju32k

Steps to reproduce:
1. Put a tooltip on a `matTabLink`
2. Disabled the `matTabLink`
 
#### Expected Behavior

Tab should be disabled, and tooltip should show.

#### Actual Behavior

Tooltip did not show.

#### Notes/Thoughts

If the input is changed to `matTabLinkDisabled`, then `disabled` and `[disabled]="true"` should still be able to work. However, it would also be possible to use `matTabLinkDisabled`, which would make it possible to disable the `MatTabLink` specifically, without disabling any other directive on the element.

I *believe* this would be a non breaking change, as the input is declared in the `inputs` field on component:

```typescript
@Directive({
  selector: '[mat-tab-link], [matTabLink]',
  exportAs: 'matTabLink',
  inputs: ['disabled', 'disableRipple', 'tabIndex'], // <== HERE
  host: {
    'class': 'mat-tab-link',
    '[attr.aria-current]': 'active ? "page" : null',
    '[attr.aria-disabled]': 'disabled',
    '[attr.tabIndex]': 'tabIndex',
    '[class.mat-tab-disabled]': 'disabled',
    '[class.mat-tab-label-active]': 'active',
  }
})
export class MatTabLink 
```
So *my understanding* is right now, you can‚Äôt read the disabled field by name anyways.

#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2.11
- CDK/Material: 8.2.1
- Browser(s): Version 77.0.3865.120 (Official Build) (64-bit)
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Debian Rodette
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "matTabLink `disabled` input should be `matTabLinkDisabled`" (#17446)

Issues.Title: fix(form-field): ensure that descendants are picked up in Ivy
Issues.Body: Since there's a slight difference in how `ContentChildren` works in Ivy, these changes add the `descendants` flag explicitly to ensure that we pick up all of the relevant elements. Note that we shouldn't need any extra logic, because nesting form fields is invalid.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(form-field): ensure that descendants are picked up in Ivy" (#17439)

Issues.Title: fix(chips): don't set aria-required when element doesn't have a role
Issues.Body:
Currently we always set `aria-required` `mat-chip-list`/`mat-chip-grid`, however it should only be set on form controls. If a chip list is empty we remove its role so we also have to clear the `aria-required`.

Fixes #17397.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(chips): don't set aria-required when element doesn't have a role" (#17425)

Issues.Title: mat-select doesn't select the focused item on tab-keypress
Issues.Body:
We switched from an other select implementation to mat-select and now some users are complaining that this is brocken and rightfully pointed out, that the native browser select behaves this way.

#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/angular/xevrkjeylnv?file=app%2Fselect-overview-example.ts

Steps to reproduce:
1. click the basic mat-select
2. use the arrow down key until "Tacos" is marked
3. press the tab key
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

I expected "Tacos" to be selected, as this is the behaviour of a native select and also the mat-select with native select.


#### Actual Behavior

Previous selected value stays selected (or nothing, if nothing was selected)


#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2.11
- CDK/Material: 8.2.1
- Browser(s): Tested with Firefox and Chrome, but probably all browsers
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "mat-select doesn't select the focused item on tab-keypress" (#17442)

Issues.Title: Angular Material - Basic Carousel
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

Initial basic carousel functionality that can be expanded on in future iterations. Basically the ability to choose the following:

- `perView` - sets items visible as the user navigates through the 
- `startsAt` - sets where the carousel should focus on init
- Arrows to move the carousel left/right

#### Use Case

The biggest benefit would be having this centralized in a community package that people can contribute to and support. Other benefits are not having to pull in dependencies like `jQuery` or vanilla packages that have issues with the lifecycle hooks of Angular.

Carousels are a very common component that people use in their Web applications. Would be awesome to see that hosted in Angular Material.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Angular Material - Basic Carousel" (#17437)

Issues.Title: Mat-Select scroll bar displayed off page or behind page scroll bar
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Stackblitz: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-xrksc1

screenshot: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49412779/67042316-a1941100-f0f5-11e9-81af-839b5fd6c224.png)


Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a mat-select component directly in the page body with enough options that a vertical scroll bar should appear. The scroll bar will display off-screen. (Example 1 in stackblitz, comment out the div.expand-page element)
2. Create a mat-select component, set it's width and float it right. Add enough options that the vertical scroll bar appears. Create a div below the mat-select element and set its height to 150vh to make a scroll bar appear on the body element. Now the mat-select component's scroll bar will be hidden behind the body elements scroll bar.
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?
The mat-select vertical scroll bar should always be visible if it exists.

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?
The mat-select scroll bar gets hidden either off-screen or behind other scroll bars

#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2.11
- CDK/Material: 8.2.3
- Browser(s): Google Chrome: Version 77.0.3865.120 (Official Build) (64-bit)
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10 Pro: version 1809
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Mat-Select scroll bar displayed off page or behind page scroll bar" (#17438)

Issues.Title: refactor: ensure hammer migration properly sets up gesture config in app module
Issues.Body:
Currently the HammerJS v9 migration relies on a few utilities from
`@schematics/angular`. Apparently these are not reliable enough for
our migration use-case, so we cannot use them.

This came up when testing the migration with more possible
scenarios in the docs app. Currently the migration is unable
to set up the gesture config (if hammer is used) in the app
module if the bootstrap module call imports it through multiple
layers of files. We can fix this, make the logic more robust and
make the code less verbose by simply using the type checker to
resolve the file that contains the app module references in a
bootstrap call (that way we do not need to deal with import resolution).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor: ensure hammer migration properly sets up gesture config in app module" (#17429)

Issues.Title: build: do not show inherited protected members in api docs
Issues.Body:
As per discussion in the team meeting, we do not want to show

Issues.Title: Material Menu: inputs are not recognized in ivy mode
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

(StackBlitz doesn't seem to support ivy)

Steps to reproduce:
1. `npm install -g @angular/cli@next`
2. `ng new app`
3. `ng add @angular/material`
4. `ng update @angular/material --next`
5. Add a basic [menu example](https://material.angular.io/components/menu/examples) using `overlapTrigger` input:

```html
  <button mat-button [matMenuTriggerFor]="menu">Menu</button>
  <mat-menu #menu="matMenu" [overlapTrigger]="false">
    <button mat-menu-item>Item 1</button>
    <button mat-menu-item>Item 2</button>
  </mat-menu>
```

6. `ng build`
 
#### Expected Behavior

The build should pass.


#### Actual Behavior

```
ERROR in src/app/app.component.html:339:29 - error TS8002: Can't bind to 'overlapTrigger' since it isn't a known property of 'mat-menu'.
1. If 'mat-menu' is an Angular component and it has 'overlapTrigger' input, then verify that it is part of this module.
2. If 'mat-menu' is a Web Component then add 'CUSTOM_ELEMENTS_SCHEMA' to the '@NgModule.schemas' of this component to suppress this message.
3. To allow any property add 'NO_ERRORS_SCHEMA' to the '@NgModule.schemas' of this component.

339   <mat-menu #menu="matMenu" [overlapTrigger]="false">
                                ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

  src/app/app.component.ts:5:16
    5   templateUrl: './app.component.html',
                     ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    Error occurs in the template of component AppComponent.
```


#### Environment

- Angular: 9.0.0-next.11
- CDK/Material: 9.0.0-next.0
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Material Menu: inputs are not recognized in ivy mode" (#17434)

Issues.Body:

* `SCROLL_DISPATCHER_PROVIDER_FACTORY` has been removed.
* `SCROLL_DISPATCHER_PROVIDER` has been removed.
* `VIEWPORT_RULER_PROVIDER_FACTORY` has been removed.
* `VIEWPORT_RULER_PROVIDER` has been removed.
